name: Morin Khuur
description: A traditional horsehead fiddle with two strings, representing a horse's head and body.

name: Yatga
description: A traditional zither-like instrument with strings that are plucked.

name: Tovshuur
description: A two-stringed lute with a long neck, often played in traditional Mongolian music.

name: Shanz
description: A long-necked, three-stringed lute with a trapezoidal soundbox.

name: Byzaanchy
description: A wind instrument made from a sheep's rib bones, producing a haunting sound.

name: Limbe
description: A flute-like instrument made from bamboo, often used in Mongolian folk music.

name: Khuuchir
description: A jew's harp-like instrument made from metal or bamboo, producing a twanging sound.

name: Yoochir
description: A hammered dulcimer with metal strings that are struck with mallets.
